intro: Schiedea martinicensis, commonly known as the Martinique rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Martinique. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a perennial species that produces vibrant pink or white flowers during the wet season. Schiedea martinicensis is also known for its ability to survive in harsh, arid conditions due to its thick, fleshy foliage.
